intro: Anemopaegma carrerense, commonly known as the Carrera's anemopaegma, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are elongated and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
